reviewText:
A great multiplayer arena shooter. It doesn't take long to unlock all the class abilities and has plenty of game modes beside the well worn VS multiplayer most of these party games have. Multiplayer works and the netcoding is better than most on the indie titles I've played. Played against a friend in Austrailia and had about 200ms response time where 200 is what he often gets in Counter Strike.

I like the variety in guns selection the most. Each gun has an alternative fire that slightly changes how it functions while maintaining the theme of the gun. For example, the Shredder launches a saw blade that has slow projectiles while it's alternate fire shoots a slightly faster projectile that isn't as accurate and does less damage. Combined with class abilities, many guns are useful and can mix up the play experience.

Highly recommend this game and it is certainly worth $2-5 pending when you get it. You should get the 4 pack due to multiplayer being pretty much dead. That is the only real negative I have about the game.

reviewText: This is a great game to play with friends. The gameplay is smooth and very well done. The story gets you ready for online play. The online community is small but still active from time to time. The gun fights can be a lot of fun and the different weapons in the game make it interesting to fight with all the variety. The online battles are fun but can be hard for new players. There is a co-op option that is fun to play with friends and see how long you can survive. The view that you get is a top down view which is great for this game but can be hard at times. It does support the Xbox controller which is a nice addition to the game. This is a great game and I highly recommend it.

reviewText: An interesting entry into the third person shooting genre, Babo Invasion has multiple classes that each have a different weapon and special power. While the linear maps of the single player does nothing for the lackluster story, the multiplayer is actually quite fun. Taking notes from Call of Duty it features class based DM and TDM with experience points to unlock new classes.

reviewText:
A fun little game. I've never heard of the Madballs thing before - apparently they were a toy in the '80s ('90s is the best) - but this top down shooter thing is solid. Both the singleplayer and multiplayer are fun with the multiplayer in particular a big surprise.

You crash on a planet or something and have to kil the bad balls because they're bad. There's a few different types of balls you can play as and they're all different enough to play fairly well.  The Story Mode gets a little repetitious, mostly due to the areas ahead being locked until you kill all the dudes the spawn. Still, pretty short and mostly fun.

Multiplayer is really fun, although there won't be any players now. I got the most out of it when there was that free weekend for it and everyone was playing. You unlock weapons and ablities as you go. It's super fast paced and you'll die a lot but once you learn you'll be killing peeps like no tomorrow.

reviewText: I remember these ugly guys when I was growing up in the 80's.  Back then they weren't much more than ugly little toy balls kids could buy, and later had a TV show that fell on its face rather quickly.  These gross toys were revived in 2006, and three years later this video game came out.  I had little hopes for this game from the start, reclaiming the obscure popularity of the toys and the general bad video games that are usually put out for children's entertainment... however, this game is none of that.  It is easily one of the most enjoyable shooter games I have played.  Players roll around as various ugly balls (each with their own special abilities) and laying waste to pretty much everything in their way.  There's a story to it, but who cares?  I'm too busy shooting crap and rolling all over the place to pay attention!

reviewText: This game is seriously one of the most overlooked fantastic games that nobody has ever heard of, I LOVED playing this on my console, and was glad to see it here on steam, sadly, there aren't enough people playing it anymore to easily get a multiplayer game in, but the rest of the game is still really fun.   it's a type of top down shooter, with a good variety of weapons, secrets, and variety in characters.   it's difficult to explain, but really worth giving it a good try, and get into it for a bit, dont just judge from the early when nothing is unlocked yet, there's a subtlety to the depth of gameplay that comes from unlocking many of the other characters and types of weaponry.

reviewText: Playbrain's latest succeeds admirably as a figurative reset button, even as it's run through with the embattled energy and strident confidence of a creator intent on rejecting the sellout accusations that forced a stylistic reboot in the first place. Madballs in Babo: Invasion" bristles with the reflexive jabs and on-the-spot opinions that tend to come during long-distance sparring sessions with the nebulous masses. The single-minded focus on wrangling a complicated commercial-vs.-underground reputation can feel exhausting at times
date: but the game's playality makes up for it
recommended: with an improved graphical delivery and a collection of beasts that expand on what drew attention to Playbrain's production at grime's onset."
voteText: true

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
As a video game based on rubber ball toys, one might expect some lame gameplay or cheap feel.

On the contrary, it is quite good.  It has simple (but challenging to master) mechanics, pretty good graphics for an isometric game, a competent UI, good physics, and a fair amount of content.  I offers multiple game modes, multiplayer (both co-op and competitive), and leaderboards (I happened to make it to #3 [at one point] global on one of the levels, yooooo).

It's a great bit of fun, and well designed for a rolling-ball type game.  It made me want to do a 360 and roll away.

reviewText: Rest in peace, servers.  I was a bit of a monster at this game back around its prime time.  Multiplayer was -so good- and all of the weapons and characters were really fun, impactful, and viable in their own way.  The combination of the 2 special abilities per character and the dual firing modes for each gun just worked out so well.  Even the story mode was a blast!  Obviously the story wasn't top notch but it was great to mow through different scenarios.\n\nNever forget~.
